blog.name: weeblifeiscomingbacktohauntme
blog.title: yoooo
blog.description: look man I just needed a place to nerd out w/o being judged

summary: Look I just need Deku and Spiderman to meet each other and fucking gush about about their mentors (lol who are we kidding? It's...
body:
Look I just need Deku and Spiderman to meet each other and fucking gush about about their mentors (lol who are we kidding? It’s their dad)

Peter: Mr.Stark gave me a new suit that adapts to my powers!!!

Izuku: All Might is teaching me how to use his!!!

-

Izuku: He’s training me how to be a hero!

Peter: He told me I already was one!

Izuku: That’s so amazing!!!!

-

Peter: He sent me to school with, like, 6 different sandwiches for lunch

Izuku: Yeah, All Might didn’t know what I wanted so he ordered everything at the cafeteria

-

Just let them be friends and bond over their hero dads!!

-

The other end of that spectrum are the super dads talking to each other about how reckless their kids are and the fear of not being a good enough role model

body:
Stephen *leaving his dog*: bye baby, I love you so much. Be good, okay? I’ll be back before you know it. You’re such a handsome boy, I love you *1000 kisses*

Stephen *leaving Tony*: bye, cya.

blog.name: lovelyirony
blog.title: sharon's a good character y'all are just mean
blog.description: icon by starkxs. name is jess, please send in a full prompt! thanks so much for stopping by, I appreciate it!

tags: they're dorks and i love them but everyone at mit is SICK OF IT
btw tony tips like five hundred percent
summary: “Safety first. What are you? FIVE?” Tony/rhodey
question: “Safety first. What are you? FIVE?” Tony/rhodey
answer:
“Oh my god, seriously?” Rhodey groans. “Safety goggles?” 

“Yes,” Tony answers primly. “I wasn’t raised like an animal, Rhodey.” 

“Oh, rich boy?” Rhodey asks. “I saw you come home last night and attack that ramen as if you were eating your last meal as a wild dog. Shut up.” Tony rolls his eyes, still snapping his goggles on. 

“I’m sorry, I’d rather be blinded by something else rather than my lack of knowledge about basic safety procedures, darling dearest.” 

“Can you guys quit flirting and actually get started on your robot?!” Kendra calls from the other side of the room. “Some of us actually ate a good breakfast!” Rhodey flips her off, but takes a pair of goggles. 

“Only because you’re a nerd for safety,” he says. 

“Whatever you say honey,” Tony responds. “Besides, don’t listen to Kendra. We’re already about two weeks ahead of schedule, and I think this one is gonna be awesome.” 

“We already built Dum-E, who you said was going to be awesome, and then he planned a road trip to downtown Boston,” Rhodey snarks. “Real classy, by the way.” 

“You’re the one who gave him a rambunctious personality,” Tony says. “I’m not responsible for that one.” 

“And yet, everyone attributes it to you,” Rhodey says. “Almost like you’re the troublemaker.” 

“You love it,” Tony grins, going in for a quick peck. “I was thinking, they put in a new Indian restaurant, and I met the new owner, and he said we should stop by for date night. They promise the best ever.” 

“You just want an opportunity to tip over a hundred percent.” 

“…correct.” Rhodey rolls his eyes. 

“Sure, babe. Six work okay for you?” 

“Yes!”

blog.name: starker-obsession
blog.title: starker-obsession
blog.description: This is a side-blog which feeds my intense Starker obsession. Hannah/25/England/ my main is: asiriuscrushonmoony

title: Confessions (Starker)
body:
Day three of StarkerValentine2019

Prompt: Confessions

this is FLUFF.  With, I guess, hints of smuttier stuff.  Enjoy!!

“I’m in love with you.”

Peter stared at his painfully awkward reflection in the bathroom mirror and groaned, leaning back against the wall.  He looked cringy. Pathetic.  And the words had sounded ridiculous in his stupid high-pitched kid voice.

“Mr Stark, I have feelings for you… and by that I mean romantic feelings.”

He hated himself.  Why was he like this?  Could he do nothing right?  He exhaled and then stared at himself, focusing.  Come on, Peter, he thought.  You can do this.

“Over the years, Mr Stark, I’ve developed these-”

A loud knock on the door made Peter stop talking immediately.  He nearly jumped out of his skin.  

“You okay in there, kid?” came Tony’s concerned voice from the other side of the door.  Peter blushed, hoping Tony hadn’t heard him practicing his awkward love confessions.

“Y-Yes!” Peter squealed embarrassingly, rushing to the door and opening it.  Tony was standing in front of him as the door opened.  Peter squeezed past him, hoping he wouldn’t be questioned as to why he’d been in the bathroom for an hour without the shower ever having been turned on.  He felt stupid - he’d told Tony he’d be taking a shower, and he had been too nervous about his confession that he’d completely forgotten to keep up the facade.

“Good shower?” Tony asked him.  Peter sighed and turned to face Tony, who had his eyebrows raised.  

God, he looks so hot, Peter thought, trying to keep his cool.  “So hot,” Peter blurted out, much to his horror.  “I mean the SHOWER.  The shower was so hot.”

“Did you even get in?”

“It was too hot for me!” Peter said quickly, feeling his cheeks go red again. 

“You do know you can turn the temperature down, don’t you?” Tony asked with the hint of a laugh in his voice.  Peter laughed. 

“Ha, stupid.  Yeah.  I knew that.  Mr Stark, I think I should get going now,” Peter said, just wanting to be out of there.  He smiled at Tony and then headed for the front door.  The whole confession thing had been a stupid idea.  He didn’t know how he’d ever thought he’d be able to go through with it.

“Hey, wait,” Tony said, walking after him and placing a hand on his shoulder to stop him.  “Peter, wait.  I want to talk to you.”

Peter stopped, trying to ignore the fluttering in his stomach he got when Tony touched him.  “Yes?” he asked, turning to face Tony and struggling to keep his voice steady.

“You seem… not your usual self.  Is everything okay with you?” Tony asked.  His hand was still on Peter’s shoulder.  IT WAS STILL ON PETER’S SHOULDER.

Peter swallowed the nervous lump in his throat and then smiled innocently at Tony.  “I’m fine.”

Tony didn’t look convinced.  “I know you.  And I know you’re lying.  You can tell me anything, you know that.”

“Anything?” Peter repeated, feeling like it would be now or never to tell Tony the truth.

“Absolutely,” Tony said with a smile of encouragement.  

“Right, well, in that case I- I’m just trying to say that, I… well… Mr Stark, I-” Peter started pacing back and forth, his face burning with every second he prolonged the embarrassing truth.  “-I’m kind of… well, not ‘kind of’ but REALLY madly in love with… er… you.  I’m in love with you.  There, I said it.”  He refused to even look Tony in the eye.  This was by far the most humiliating moment of his life - even worse than the time Flash had hidden his clothes after gym, worse even than the time Aunt May had walked in on him watching porn.

The silence was becoming deafening.  Wasn’t Tony going to SAY SOMETHING?! Peter wanted the floor to open up and eat him whole.  He continued staring at the floor, praying for Tony to say something… anything… even a rejection would be better than this painful silence.

When Tony didn’t speak, Peter knew it was time to bolt.  “I- I’ll just leave, then,” Peter murmured, still avoiding eye contact and turning to walk towards the door.  As he turned, he felt a hand grasp his arm, holding him back.

“Don’t leave,” Tony said, his voice sounding soft, surprisingly vulnerable.  

“Why?” Peter asked.  His heart was thumping in his chest so hard that he was sure that Tony could hear it.

Tony sighed, his hand still gripping Peter’s arm.  It would have hurt if Peter wasn’t too focused on everything else that was going on.  “Because I… want you.”

Peter blinked and stared at Tony.  “You…. want me?”

“Yeah, I- fuck.  Peter, we can’t.  It’s wrong.” 

Peter stepped closer to Tony, feeling a sudden save of confidence wash over him.  “It’s not wrong, Mr Stark.  I’m eighteen.”

Tony laughed, although Peter could tell he didn’t think anything was funny.  “You turned eighteen four months ago,” Tony said, loosening his grip on Peter’s arm and shaking his head.  “I’m over double your age.  We both know it’s wrong.”

“I don’t care,” Peter whispered desperately.  “Please, it’s all I want.”

“Peter, I-”

Peter leaned in to close the gap between them, breaking Tony off mid-sentence and catching the older man by surprise.  Tony let go of Peter’s arm completely and let both his arms move up to wrap easily around Peter’s small waist, pulling him closer so their bodies were pressed together.  The kiss wasn’t heated, but it was passionate.  It wasn’t rough, but it was intense.  It was an exploration; an experimentation.  And God, it was so good.  Peter didn’t want it to ever end, but soon enough, Tony’s lips were gone.

Tony’s arms were still wrapped around Peter.  “I kinda really love you too, Peter,” Tony said with the most heart-warming smile Peter had ever seen in his life.  But the younger man couldn’t believe his ears - had Tony really just said that?  Well, what had he really expected?  Tony had just KISSED him.  There had to have been some feelings, but… love?

“Mr Stark-”

“-Call me Tony,” Tony said softly, pulling Peter closer yet.  He leaned in towards Peter’s ear.  “You can call me ‘Mr Stark’ in the bedroom,” he whispered.

Peter felt like his legs would collapse beneath him.  Had Tony just insinuated… had he just suggested… 

“Fuck,” Peter muttered, despite the fact that the man who always berated him for swearing was standing right in front of him.  

“Yeah, we can do that too,” Tony smirked. 

“Mr- Tony!” Peter exclaimed, blushing deeply.

“Mr Tony?” Tony smiled.  “That’s a new one.”

“I- uh-”

“-Kiss me again,” Tony murmured, interrupting his nervous stuttering.  And how could Peter say no?  How could he refuse the beautiful man in front of him?  So he obliged, with pleasure.  It was the best day of his life.

“Mr Tony?” Tony smiled.  “That’s a new one.”

“I- uh-”

“-Kiss me again,” Tony murmured, interrupting his nervous stuttering.  And how could Peter say no?  How could he refuse the beautiful man in front of him?  So he obliged, with pleasure.  It was the best day of his life.

trail.content_raw:
Day three of StarkerValentine2019

Prompt: Confessions

this is FLUFF.  With, I guess, hints of smuttier stuff.  Enjoy!!

“I’m in love with you.”

Peter stared at his painfully awkward reflection in the bathroom mirror and groaned, leaning back against the wall.  He looked cringy. Pathetic.  And the words had sounded ridiculous in his stupid high-pitched kid voice.

“Mr Stark, I have feelings for you… and by that I mean romantic feelings.”

He hated himself.  Why was he like this?  Could he do nothing right?  He exhaled and then stared at himself, focusing.  Come on, Peter, he thought.  You can do this.

“Over the years, Mr Stark, I’ve developed these-”

A loud knock on the door made Peter stop talking immediately.  He nearly jumped out of his skin.  

“You okay in there, kid?” came Tony’s concerned voice from the other side of the door.  Peter blushed, hoping Tony hadn’t heard him practicing his awkward love confessions.

“Y-Yes!” Peter squealed embarrassingly, rushing to the door and opening it.  Tony was standing in front of him as the door opened.  Peter squeezed past him, hoping he wouldn’t be questioned as to why he’d been in the bathroom for an hour without the shower ever having been turned on.  He felt stupid - he’d told Tony he’d be taking a shower, and he had been too nervous about his confession that he’d completely forgotten to keep up the facade.

“Good shower?” Tony asked him.  Peter sighed and turned to face Tony, who had his eyebrows raised.  

God, he looks so hot, Peter thought, trying to keep his cool.  “So hot,” Peter blurted out, much to his horror.  “I mean the SHOWER.  The shower was so hot.”

“Did you even get in?”

“It was too hot for me!” Peter said quickly, feeling his cheeks go red again. 

“You do know you can turn the temperature down, don’t you?” Tony asked with the hint of a laugh in his voice.  Peter laughed. 

“Ha, stupid.  Yeah.  I knew that.  Mr Stark, I think I should get going now,” Peter said, just wanting to be out of there.  He smiled at Tony and then headed for the front door.  The whole confession thing had been a stupid idea.  He didn’t know how he’d ever thought he’d be able to go through with it.

“Hey, wait,” Tony said, walking after him and placing a hand on his shoulder to stop him.  “Peter, wait.  I want to talk to you.”

Peter stopped, trying to ignore the fluttering in his stomach he got when Tony touched him.  “Yes?” he asked, turning to face Tony and struggling to keep his voice steady.

“You seem… not your usual self.  Is everything okay with you?” Tony asked.  His hand was still on Peter’s shoulder.  IT WAS STILL ON PETER’S SHOULDER.

Peter swallowed the nervous lump in his throat and then smiled innocently at Tony.  “I’m fine.”

Tony didn’t look convinced.  “I know you.  And I know you’re lying.  You can tell me anything, you know that.”

“Anything?” Peter repeated, feeling like it would be now or never to tell Tony the truth.

“Absolutely,” Tony said with a smile of encouragement.  

“Right, well, in that case I- I’m just trying to say that, I… well… Mr Stark, I-” Peter started pacing back and forth, his face burning with every second he prolonged the embarrassing truth.  “-I’m kind of… well, not ‘kind of’ but REALLY madly in love with… er… you.  I’m in love with you.  There, I said it.”  He refused to even look Tony in the eye.  This was by far the most humiliating moment of his life - even worse than the time Flash had hidden his clothes after gym, worse even than the time Aunt May had walked in on him watching porn.

The silence was becoming deafening.  Wasn’t Tony going to SAY SOMETHING?! Peter wanted the floor to open up and eat him whole.  He continued staring at the floor, praying for Tony to say something… anything… even a rejection would be better than this painful silence.

When Tony didn’t speak, Peter knew it was time to bolt.  “I- I’ll just leave, then,” Peter murmured, still avoiding eye contact and turning to walk towards the door.  As he turned, he felt a hand grasp his arm, holding him back.

“Don’t leave,” Tony said, his voice sounding soft, surprisingly vulnerable.  

“Why?” Peter asked.  His heart was thumping in his chest so hard that he was sure that Tony could hear it.

Tony sighed, his hand still gripping Peter’s arm.  It would have hurt if Peter wasn’t too focused on everything else that was going on.  “Because I… want you.”

Peter blinked and stared at Tony.  “You…. want me?”

“Yeah, I- fuck.  Peter, we can’t.  It’s wrong.” 

Peter stepped closer to Tony, feeling a sudden save of confidence wash over him.  “It’s not wrong, Mr Stark.  I’m eighteen.”

Tony laughed, although Peter could tell he didn’t think anything was funny.  “You turned eighteen four months ago,” Tony said, loosening his grip on Peter’s arm and shaking his head.  “I’m over double your age.  We both know it’s wrong.”

“I don’t care,” Peter whispered desperately.  “Please, it’s all I want.”

“Peter, I-”

Peter leaned in to close the gap between them, breaking Tony off mid-sentence and catching the older man by surprise.  Tony let go of Peter’s arm completely and let both his arms move up to wrap easily around Peter’s small waist, pulling him closer so their bodies were pressed together.  The kiss wasn’t heated, but it was passionate.  It wasn’t rough, but it was intense.  It was an exploration; an experimentation.  And God, it was so good.  Peter didn’t want it to ever end, but soon enough, Tony’s lips were gone.

Tony’s arms were still wrapped around Peter.  “I kinda really love you too, Peter,” Tony said with the most heart-warming smile Peter had ever seen in his life.  But the younger man couldn’t believe his ears - had Tony really just said that?  Well, what had he really expected?  Tony had just KISSED him.  There had to have been some feelings, but… love?

“Mr Stark-”

“-Call me Tony,” Tony said softly, pulling Peter closer yet.  He leaned in towards Peter’s ear.  “You can call me ‘Mr Stark’ in the bedroom,” he whispered.

Peter felt like his legs would collapse beneath him.  Had Tony just insinuated… had he just suggested… 

“Fuck,” Peter muttered, despite the fact that the man who always berated him for swearing was standing right in front of him.  

“Yeah, we can do that too,” Tony smirked. 

“Mr- Tony!” Peter exclaimed, blushing deeply.

“Mr Tony?” Tony smiled.  “That’s a new one.”

“I- uh-”

“-Kiss me again,” Tony murmured, interrupting his nervous stuttering.  And how could Peter say no?  How could he refuse the beautiful man in front of him?  So he obliged, with pleasure.  It was the best day of his life.

Tony didn’t look convinced.  “I know you.  And I know you’re lying.  You can tell me anything, you know that.”

“Anything?” Peter repeated, feeling like it would be now or never to tell Tony the truth.

“Absolutely,” Tony said with a smile of encouragement.

The silence was becoming deafening.  Wasn’t Tony going to SAY SOMETHING?! Peter wanted the floor to open up and eat him whole.  He continued staring at the floor, praying for Tony to say something… anything… even a rejection would be better than this painful silence.

When Tony didn’t speak, Peter knew it was time to bolt.  “I- I’ll just leave, then,” Peter murmured, still avoiding eye contact and turning to walk towards the door.  As he turned, he felt a hand grasp his arm, holding him back.

“Don’t leave,” Tony said, his voice sounding soft, surprisingly vulnerable.

Tony sighed, his hand still gripping Peter’s arm.  It would have hurt if Peter wasn’t too focused on everything else that was going on.  “Because I… want you.”

Peter blinked and stared at Tony.  “You…. want me?”

“Yeah, I- fuck.  Peter, we can’t.  It’s wrong.” 

Peter stepped closer to Tony, feeling a sudden save of confidence wash over him.  “It’s not wrong, Mr Stark.  I’m eighteen.”

Tony laughed, although Peter could tell he didn’t think anything was funny.  “You turned eighteen four months ago,” Tony said, loosening his grip on Peter’s arm and shaking his head.  “I’m over double your age.  We both know it’s wrong.”

title: Boo you whore!
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2SFgFgs

by MaybeIWantTheOceanToBurn

A couple of years after Civil War, Harley Keener’s mother dies, and Tony Stark decides to take him in.

Harley isn’t sure who this peter kid is that Tony and his boyfriend James keep mentioning, but he doesn’t like how much they talk about him.

title: Peter Parkers BioChem Field Trip
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2X64c47

by maroongrad

Peter’s senior Biochemistry class goes on a field trip to Stark Tower. Yep, same ol’ Field Trip Trope but hopefully a different take. Tony and Pepper are acting as parental figures alongside Aunt May, and Peter spends plenty of time at the Tower and Compound. Assume all the Avengers are a big happy family and IW never happened. But, Flash is still a jerk, most people aren’t really sure the intership exists, and Tony and Pepper decide to something great for their favorite intern. More realistically, as functioning Adults™ the Avengers do not spend all their time playing MarioKart and engaging in prank wars with nerf guns. This does not mean they are not little shits though ;)

Words: 1624, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Gen
  • Characters: Peter Parker, Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Flash Thompson, Michelle Jones, Bruce Banner
  • Relationships: Peter Parker/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Field Trip, spiderman - Freeform, Spider-Man - Freeform, Decathlon, SI, Avengers Compound, School, class, Bullying, tired of the standard field trip trope and trying something new, I should be grading papers, lesson plans what lesson plans, IW never happened, forget about CW too, Tony is a great mentor, Flash is a dick, not all teachers are oblivious


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2X64c47

by maroongrad

Peter’s senior Biochemistry class goes on a field trip to Stark Tower. Yep, same ol’ Field Trip Trope but hopefully a different take. Tony and Pepper are acting as parental figures alongside Aunt May, and Peter spends plenty of time at the Tower and Compound. Assume all the Avengers are a big happy family and IW never happened. But, Flash is still a jerk, most people aren’t really sure the intership exists, and Tony and Pepper decide to something great for their favorite intern. More realistically, as functioning Adults™ the Avengers do not spend all their time playing MarioKart and engaging in prank wars with nerf guns. This does not mean they are not little shits though ;)

title: Guys, I really, really need
body:
Tony Stark and Hank Pym to be insulting each other in the lab, trying to out-do each other, until Princess Shuri comes along and utterly slaughters both of them in front of the whole scientific community, causing Tony and Hank to berudgingly form an alliance in order to beat a new common rival. Rocket Raccoon joins in as well, and an experiment with Pym Particles goes wrong, resulting in a Monty Python skit come to life. 

Shuri and Bruce Banner then step in to help resolve the giant-raccoon situation.

title: Been a Bad Girl, Daddy
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2BDbjHU

by starkerchemistry

The anger that follows that burns even hotter, and Bucky has to fight back the immediate growl of ‘mine’ that rides on its heels, and he can’t really pretend anymore that what he’s feeling isn’t arousal, that he isn’t out of his mind with jealousy at the image of his pretty, dolled up son choking on a stranger’s cock in an alley and liking it.

He needs to be alone with Tony, now.
